data.description: Under the Mukhyamantri Kanyadaan Yojana, eligible daughters from poor families in Jharkhand receive ₹30,000 as financial assistance at the time of marriage. The scheme aims to prevent child marriage and promote women's economic empowerment. Required documents include ration card, Aadhaar, marriage certificate, and the girl's name in the voter list.

The scheme provides ₹30,000 to eligible daughters at marriage. Exceptions apply for orphans and shelter home residents. Applications are submitted to CDPO with required documents. After verification and approval, funds are directly transferred to the beneficiary's bank account through PFMS/NEFT.

The scheme has an annual budget of ₹50 crore, with 2% allocated for publicity and administration. Approved in the State Cabinet meeting on 14.08.2019, it replaces all previous orders and is effective from the date of issuance. The resolution is to be published in the Jharkhand Gazette for official record.

Hostel allowance for SC/ST/OBC students of classes 6 to 8 under Jharkhand Pre-Matric Scholarship has been increased from ₹2000 to ₹2500. This amendment, approved on 01.12.2022, updates earlier notifications and will be published in the state gazette.

Savitribai Phule Kishori Samridhi Yojana replaces the earlier Mukhyamantri Sukanya Yojana to promote girls' education and empowerment. Eligible girls from Class 8 to age 19 will receive financial support ranging from ₹2500 to ₹20000 under the revised scheme.

The scheme benefits the first two daughters of non-government, non-pensioned, non-taxpaying parents. Girls in classes 8–12 in government or aided schools are eligible. Aadhaar, birth certificate, bank details, and guardian documents (if applicable) are required with the application.

Disabled girls are exempt from key conditions. Final benefit requires age 18–19 and voter ID. Applications are submitted manually via CDPO or Anganwadi. After verification, funds are transferred to bank accounts. Estimated 2022–23 expenditure exceeds ₹239 crore across eligible student categories.

For FY 2022–23, ₹1147.90 crore is allocated for "Savitribai Phule Kishori Samridhi Yojana." Estimated beneficiary count is over 8.8 lakh. 2% of the budget is for publicity/admin. Prior resolutions are repealed. Scheme approved in Cabinet meeting on 24.08.2022.

Widow remarriage beneficiaries must apply within 1 year of marriage with Aadhaar, marriage and death certificates, and self-declarations. Husbands must not be government-employed or taxpayers. Verified applications are approved by DSWO. ₹100 lakh is allocated for FY 2023–24.

A budget of ₹1 crore (₹52 lakh under TSP, ₹48 lakh under OSP) is allocated for the BA–Women and Adolescent Welfare Scheme in FY 2023–24. Funds will be withdrawn from designated treasury heads and managed by authorized expenditure officers.

The 2022 rules aim to provide post-matric scholarships to ST, SC, and OBC students in Jharkhand. Applications, verification, and payments occur via the e-Kalyan portal. Aadhaar-based unique IDs and mobile updates ensure transparency. Rule amendments follow central government changes.

The 2022 Jharkhand Post-Matric Scholarship Rules update scholarship provisions for SC, ST, and OBC students. It includes rule notifications, revised expenditure of ₹650 crore, and detailed budget allocations across various welfare departments for both academic and technical scholarships.

This resolution allocates and revokes scholarship funds for ST and OBC students under Tribal Area Sub-plans, nullifies previous orders, assigns Ranchi for legal jurisdiction, and mandates publication in the Jharkhand Gazette with specific budget tracking codes.

The 2022 Jharkhand SC Post-Matric Scholarship Rules aim to boost SC student participation in higher education by offering financial aid. Eligible students and institutions must register on the scholarship portal. Courses are grouped based on NAAC accreditation and program type.

This section outlines institutional eligibility for Jharkhand's SC Post-Matric Scholarship, requiring NAAC/NBA accreditation, AISHE/U-DISE codes, portal registration, periodic audits, geo-tagging, and income limits per central guidelines, with monitoring by the Tribal Welfare Commissioner.

The scholarship requires Aadhaar-based online applications, verification by institutions and District Welfare Officers, and prohibits duplicate benefits. Fraud or false documents lead to disqualification and recovery. Only students with valid documents and Aadhaar-linked accounts are eligible.

Scholarship applications are verified by institutions and District Welfare Officers, then approved by a district-level committee. State and district nodal officers manage processes. Committees also verify and approve educational institutions eligible for the scheme through on-site and archival checks.

Scholarship approval for out-of-state institutions is done by a state-level committee after verification. Scholarship amounts are capped by course group, covering tuition and allowances. The total aid follows Government of India norms and cannot exceed specified maximum limits.

Scholarship funds are transferred via DBT to Aadhaar-linked accounts. Students receive SMS updates. Complaints are resolved within 72 hours. Regular audits ensure transparency. The department can update rules, portal, and course groups per central/state directives and financial considerations.

The memorandum, dated 29.08.2022, outlines instructions from the government regarding the Post Matric Scholarship Scheme. It is circulated to key officials and departments for necessary action and published in the official gazette for formal notification.

The Jharkhand ST Post-Matric Scholarship Rules, 2022 aim to support tribal students in post-matric education through financial aid. It categorizes eligible courses into defined groups based on institution accreditation and course type for streamlined scholarship distribution.

Educational institutions must meet eligibility criteria, possess AISHE/U-DISE codes, and register on the portal. A nodal officer is required. Geo-tagging, audits, inspections, and income below ₹2.5 lakh are mandatory for Scheduled Tribe student scholarship benefits under Jharkhand rules

Online application with Aadhaar and verified documents is mandatory. Students must use Aadhaar-linked bank accounts. District and institutional nodal officers verify applications. Fraud or duplicate benefits lead to disqualification. Only one scholarship per academic year is allowed under this scheme.

District Nodal Officers review applications, which are approved by a District-level Committee led by the Deputy Commissioner. Committees verify eligibility, approve institutions, and ensure accuracy. State Nodal Officers manage payments. Verification and on-site checks are mandatory for institution and student approval.

Scholarship approval for out-of-state institutions requires a high-level committee's verification. The scholarship covers tuition and maintenance fees within set limits, varying by course group and residency. Maximum aid is ₹1,00,000 for hostellers and ₹90,000 for day-scholars in Group 1A.

Students receive SMS updates on application status. Complaints are handled via the e-Kalyan portal within 72 hours. Annual audits and evaluations ensure transparency. The Tribal Welfare Department and Ministry of Tribal Affairs manage rule changes, course group updates, and IT portal modifications.

Official memo issued by the Government of Jharkhand regarding the Post Matric Scholarship scheme. Sent to senior officials and departments for information and action. Also includes instructions for gazette publication and distribution of 300 printed copies.

The Jharkhand Backward Class Post-Matric Scholarship Rules, 2022 aim to support backward class students through financial aid. Eligibility includes Jharkhand residence, course attendance, and enrollment in approved institutions across categorized professional, graduate, and vocational programs under defined course groups.

Institutions must register on the scholarship portal with valid AISHE/U-DISE codes and follow academic norms. A nodal officer handles scholarship tasks. Income limit for students' families is ₹2.5 lakh annually. Regular audits, inspections, and geo-tagging are mandatory.

Students must apply online with Aadhaar-linked bank details and required certificates. Institutions verify applications. Fraud or duplicate benefits lead to disqualification and recovery. Verification is done by district, state, and institute nodal officers using designated portal credentials.

District-level committees, led by the Deputy Commissioner, review and approve student applications and institution eligibility after DNO verification. Committees ensure application accuracy, conduct site checks, and validate institutional data before approving scholarships through the official portal system.

Scholarships are capped by course group and student type (hosteller/day-scholar). Approvals for out-of-state institutions follow strict verification by a senior committee. Final amounts include tuition and allowances but cannot exceed specified maximums based on Ministry of Social Justice norms.

Students receive SMS updates at each application stage. Complaints are resolved within 72 hours. Annual audits and a 3-year evaluation ensure transparency. The department can update portal rules or course groups based on central/state-level changes and financial implications.

Official notification dated 29.08.2022 issued under Resolution No. 2587 outlines scholarship-related instructions. It includes distribution to key officials and departments for implementation, and requests Gazette publication with 300 copies for departmental use. Signed by Secretary Kamal Kishor Son.

Jharkhand Pre-Matric Scholarship Rules, 2022 aim to support ST, SC, and OBC students (Classes 1–10) in government schools by formalizing procedures, reducing dropouts, and ensuring transparency. A separate budget is allocated for Classes 9–10 from 2022–23.

Jharkhand Pre-Matric Scholarship Rules, 2022, cover SC, ST, and OBC students from Classes 1–10. Application, verification, and payment occur via the e-Kalyan portal with Aadhaar-based unique ID and SMS updates. Rules formalized via notifications dated 29.08.2022.

Budget allocations for Jharkhand's Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme (Classes I–X) are structured under Demand No. 51 across SC, ST, and OBC categories, with specific major/minor heads and grant codes for fund disbursement and implementation tracking.

Government order finalizes budget allocations for pre-matric and high school scholarships for SC, ST, and OBC students in Jharkhand. Includes detailed codes, departmental approvals, and mandates publication in the state gazette. Ranchi court holds jurisdiction over disputes.

Government order issued on 29.08.2022 directs the publication of pre-matric scholarship rules in the Jharkhand Gazette. 300 copies requested. Official communication signed by Secretary Kamal Kishore Son under reference number 03/Scholarship (Pre-Matric)-02/2022-2583.

The 2022 Jharkhand SC Pre-Matric Scholarship Rules aim to boost SC student enrollment in Classes 1–10. Scholarships apply to government school students in Jharkhand. Income limit applies for Classes 9–10; self-declaration of income is accepted.

This section outlines the scholarship approval workflow on the e-Kalyan portal. School headmasters input student data; District Welfare Officers verify and forward it. A district committee, led by the Deputy Commissioner, approves applications within 7 days after verification.

The section details scholarship rates for Scheduled Caste students from Class 1–10, payment split between state and central governments, and DBT process. Payments are made via PFMS using Aadhaar-linked accounts (APBS) or non-Aadhaar-linked accounts (NACH).

KYC for scholarship accounts is valid for 10 years. Students get SMS updates via e-Kalyan. Complaints are resolved within 72 hours. Audits and IT changes managed by authorities. Rule amendments depend on financial impact. Notification issued under cabinet approval.

Jharkhand's 2022 Pre-Matric Scholarship Rules aim to support Scheduled Tribe students from Classes 1–10, ensuring equal education opportunities, reducing dropouts, and offering income-based benefits, especially for Classes 9–10, with implementation based on Government of India guidelines.

The process outlines roles of school headmasters (INO), District Welfare Officers (DNO), and State Nodal Officers (SNO) for student registration and Aadhaar-based verification on e-Kalyan, with final approval by a district-level committee led by the Deputy Commissioner.

The scholarship provides ₹1500–₹4500 annually for Scheduled Tribe students (Classes 1–10), with payments through DBT via PFMS. Funding is fully state-supported for Classes 1–8, and 75:25 shared with the central government for Classes 9–10.

Scholarships for Classes 9–10 are transferred via DBT linked with Aadhaar. KYC is mandatory every 10 years. Complaints are handled within 72 hours. Monitoring is done via e-Kalyan. State/department can amend rules based on financial impact.

The Jharkhand Backward Class Pre-Matric Scholarship Rules, 2022 aim to support students from Classes 1–10 in government schools by reducing dropouts. Scholarships have no income limit for Classes 1–8; ₹2.5 lakh limit applies for Classes 9–10.

The e-Kalyan portal assigns roles to school and district officials for student registration and verification. Aadhaar-based authentication generates a unique student ID. A district committee reviews and approves applications, with the State Nodal Officer overseeing payment processing at the state level.

The scholarship rates for backward class students from Classes 1–10 were revised, with payments made via DBT through PFMS. For Classes 9–10, funding is shared 60:40 between the central and state governments. Changes depend on future financial impact.

Scholarship payments require Aadhaar-linked accounts via APBS. KYC is mandatory every 10 years. Students receive SMS updates. Grievances are resolved within 72 hours. The scheme allows audits and portal updates. Rule changes depend on financial impact on the state.

The final memorandum confirms distribution of scholarship guidelines to key officials and departments for implementation. It includes instructions for gazette publication of the order and ensures that all stakeholders are informed for necessary action across Jharkhand's administrative framework.
